enum.name: ExtRecState
enum.description: State of extended recovery actions that may affect traffic in other cells.

enum.name: Days
enum.description: Presents a day of the week only.

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is partially or fully operable.

enumMember.name: FAULTY_INPUT
enumMember.description: Input data for collection is incomplete or incorrectly specified.

enum.name: SchStatus
enum.description: Status of the functionality Sleeping Cell Healing.

enumMember.name: LEARNING
enumMember.description: The functionality is working and learning the traffic pattern data.

enumMember.name: FAULT
enumMember.description: Not possible to generate a report.

enum.name: BasicAdmState
enum.description: Basic administrative states for a resource.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

enumMember.name: HEALTHY
enumMember.description: No issues are present in the node.

enumMember.name: NOT_HEALTHY
enumMember.description: Major issues are present in the node.

enumMember.name: WARNING
enumMember.description: Minor issues are present in the node.

enumMember.name: INITIAL_DATA_COLLECTION
enumMember.description: Data collection to produce the output is ongoing.

enumMember.name: FAULT
enumMember.description: A fault has occured during calculation.

derivedDataType.name: CellName
derivedDataType.description: Defines a symbolic name for a cell. The cell name ALL is not allowed.

derivedDataType.name: SimpleTime
derivedDataType.description: Represents a simplified representation of local time (ISO 8601). The following pattern describes the SimpleTime format: hh:mm Where: hh = Two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = Two digits of minute (00 through 59)

rule.exceptionText: Must be of the format HH:MM where HH = Two digits of hour (00 through 23) and MM = Two digits of minute (00 through 59). Example 16:20.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

derivedDataType.name: Date
derivedDataType.description: Represents the international standard for the representation of date (ISO 8601). The string format is "YYYY-MM-DD" (excluding quotes). The following pattern describes the Date format: YYYY-MM-DD Where: YYYY = Four digit year MM = Two digit month (01=January, and so on) DD = Two digit day of month (01 through 31)

rule.exceptionText: Must be of the format YYYY-MM-DD where YYYY = Four digit year, MM = Two digit month (01 through 12) and DD = Two digit day (01 through 31). Example 2000-12-23.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

derivedDataType.name: DateTime
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the international standard for the representation of date and time ( ISO 8601). The string format is "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ" (excluding quotes). A DateTime string consists of a date part, a time part, and an optional time zone information part. The time zone part may be a "Z", representing the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone (equals to +00) or a time zone offset (for example, +02:00). If the time zone part is not present, the DateTime value represents local time.
The following pattern describes the DateTime format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.S+][Z|+-hh:mm] Where: YYYY = Four digit year MM = Two digit month (01=January, and so on) DD = Two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = Time designator (shows start of time component) hh = Two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = Two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = Two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) S+ = One or more digits of decimal fraction of a second Z = Time is UTC +- = + or - character indicating positive or negative offset to UTC
DateTime values are compliant with ISO 8601 "Representation of dates and times" but are restricted according to RFC 3339 "Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps". The DateTime format is further restricted as follows: - T and Z designators are upper case. - . (dot) is used to indicate start of fractions of seconds (ISO 8601 also allows comma)

rule.exceptionText: Must be of the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.S+][Z|+-hh:mm] where T separates the time and the date parts and Z indicates the time zone in relation to UTC. Example 2000-08-01T17:17:34.1+01:00.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

class.name: BscSupportFunction
class.description:
Contains data for configuration of BSC support functionalities.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: bscSupportFunctionId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: release
userLabel
attribute.description: Used for product free-text description. {apmml-nosync}

class.name: AutomaticCsrDataCollection
class.description:
Contains the functionality Automatic CSR Data Collection configuration.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: automaticCsrDataCollectionId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the functionality Automatic CSR Data Collection.

class.name: BscCpHealthCheck
class.description:
Contains the BSC CP periodic health check configuration. Health check is started periodically at time specified by the attribute scheduledTime.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: bscCpHealthCheckId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: Wanted state of the BSC CP periodic health check.

attribute.name: nodeState
attribute.description:
State of the BSC node after the health check is performed.
NOT_HEALTHY - Additional information can be found in /support_data/acdc/HC_REPORT for last scheduled period.

attribute.name: scheduledTime
attribute.description: Time when the BSC CP periodic health check starts.

attribute.name: currentState
attribute.description:
Current state of the BSC CP periodic health check.
RUNNING - If the state is RUNNING, the health check is executed in scheduled time.

class.name: EventListener
class.description:
Contains the event listener configuration.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: eventListenerId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: Wanted state of the event listener.

attribute.name: lastEvent
attribute.description:
The last CP event handled by event listener.
For more information on BSC alarms, supported by event listener, see DCG chapter 3.3.4.4.

attribute.name: currentState
attribute.description:
Current state of the event listener.
RUNNING - If the state is RUNNING, the events and alarms are detected. Relevant actions can be triggered based on the nature of event (for example, Data Collection Guideline chapter collection or OPI administering).

class.name: DataCollectionGuidelineM
class.description:
Contains the Data Collection Guideline automatic gathering configuration. Data collection is started when the value of attribute inputChapter is changed.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: dataCollectionGuidelineMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: inputChapter
attribute.description:
Data Collection Guideline chapter which must be gathered.
For more information on chapters, available for gathering, see Data Collection Guideline Chapter 3.2.1.

attribute.name: inputData
attribute.description:
Additional data to the value of attribute inputChapter.
Relevant input data for each input chapter can be found in Data Collection Guideline chapter 3.2.1.

attribute.name: dataCollectionStatus
attribute.description:
Status of the Data Collection Guideline output.
FAULTY_INPUT - The status is FAULTY_INPUT when a wrong value of the attribute inputChapter or inputData is specified. For more information on valid chapters and input data, see Data Collection Guideline chapter 3.2.1.

attribute.name: progressPercentage
attribute.description:
Chapter collection progress.
This attribute shows progress percentage during collection of DCG chapter.

attribute.name: expertMode
attribute.description:
Enable RP printouts collection.
This attribute enables collecting of RP printouts during collection of DCG chapter. When ongoing transaction is finished the attribute value is set to default value that is FALSE.

attribute.name: skipBlockDumping
attribute.description:
Skip block dumping.
This attribute allows to skip block dumping during collection of DCG chapter. When ongoing transaction is finished the attribute value is set to default value that is FALSE.

class.name: BtsDataCollection
class.description:
Contains the BTS data collection configuration. The BTS data collection is started when value of the attribute input is changed.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: btsDataCollectionId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: dataCollectionStatus
attribute.description:
Status of BTS data collection.
FAULTY_INPUT - The status is FAULTY_INPUT when a wrong value of the attribute input is specified.

attribute.name: input
attribute.description: CF MO in BTS logical model G12 for which the logs are gathered.

class.name: AutomaticPerformanceValidation
class.description:
Contains the functionality Automatic Performance Validation configuration.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: automaticPerformanceValidationId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: Wanted state of the functionality Automatic Performance Validation.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the functionality Automatic Performance Validation.

attribute.name: currentState
attribute.description: Current state of the functionality Automatic Performance Validation.

class.name: KeyPerformanceIndicatorM
class.description:
This MOC contains the BSC KPI data.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: keyPerformanceIndicatorMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: lastKpiUpdate
attribute.description: Time of last KPI update.

class.name: KeyPerformanceIndicator
class.description:
Contains the attributes for Key Performance Indicator configuration.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: keyPerformanceIndicatorId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: threshold
attribute.description:
Value used as pass criteria for KPI validation.
When the KPI value reaches the defined threshold, the KPI is highlighted in KPI validation report.

attribute.name: bscLevelValue
attribute.description: Average KPI value calculated on the BSC level.

class.name: KeyPerformanceIndicatorReport
class.description:
Allows to prepare KPI validation report in HTML format.
This MO is created by the system.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='reportRule' test="( (not((../@administrativeState = 0) and (@generateReport = 1))) )">It is not possible to generate a report when the attribute AutomaticPerformanceValidation.administrativeState is set to LOCKED. Faulty MO: <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='reportRule' test="( (not((../@administrativeState = 0) and (@generateReport = 1))) )">It is not possible to generate a report when the attribute AutomaticPerformanceValidation.administrativeState is set to LOCKED. Faulty MO: <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: keyPerformanceIndicatorReportId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: reportStatus
attribute.description: Actual status of report generation.

attribute.name: generateReport
attribute.description:
Creates a new KPI report.
To create new KPI report, value of the attribute should be changed to ENABLED. After the report is created, value of the attribute is changed to DISABLED automatically.

class.name: AdaptiveBscSettings
class.description:
Contains the functionality Adaptive BSC Settings configuration.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: adaptiveBscSettingsId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the functionality Adaptive BSC Settings.

attribute.name: startTime
attribute.description: Time when the functionality Adaptive BSC Settings starts.

attribute.name: currentState
attribute.description: Current state of the functionality Adaptive BSC Settings.

class.name: QualityBasedTimeslotAllocation
class.description:
Contains the functionality Quality based Timeslot Allocation configuration.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: qualityBasedTimeslotAllocationId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: AdaptiveSdcchConfiguration
class.description:
Contains the configuration of adaptive SDCCH part of ABS.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: Wanted state of the adaptive SDCCH part of ABS.

attribute.name: adaptiveSdcchConfigurationId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: asdcchConfigAutomationStatus
attribute.description: Status of Adaptive SDCCH Configuration Automation.

class.name: PerformanceComparison
class.description:
Contains the Performance Comparison configuration.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: performanceComparisonId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: reportStatus
attribute.description: The actual status of report generation.

attribute.name: startOfReferencePeriod
attribute.description: The start date of reference period.

attribute.name: startOfTestPeriod
attribute.description: The start date of test period.

attribute.name: periodLength
attribute.description: The length of reference or test period. Set as a number of 1-day periods.

class.name: ScldAutomation
class.description:
Contains the configuration of the SCLD Automation, part of ABS.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: scldAutomationId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: Wanted state of the SCLD Automation, part of ABS.

attribute.name: scldConfigAutomationStatus
attribute.description: Status of SCLD Configuration Automation.

class.name: AutomaticGsmHealing
class.description:
Contains the functionality Automatic GSM Healing configuration.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: automaticGsmHealingId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: Wanted state of the functionality Automatic GSM Healing.

attribute.name: currentState
attribute.description: Current state of the functionality Automatic GSM Healing.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the functionality Automatic GSM Healing.

attribute.name: sleepingCellExtndRecoveryState
attribute.description:
The state of the sleeping cell recovery.
When the state is set to LOCKED recovery actions that may affect traffic in healthy cells are not executed during maintenance, low traffic hours. When the state is set to UNLOCKED recovery actions that may affect traffic in healthy cells are executed during maintenance, low traffic hours.
attribute.statusInformation: Since GBSC01.A12 release, change of this attribute has no impact on the BSC behavior.

attribute.name: sleepingCellRecovery
attribute.description:
The state of the sleeping cell recovery.
When the state is set to LOCKED recovery actions that may affect traffic in healthy cells are not executed during maintenance, low traffic hours. When the state is set to UNLOCKED recovery actions that may affect traffic in healthy cells are executed during maintenance, low traffic hours.
attribute.statusInformation: Obsolete: Since GBSC01.A03 release, change of this attribute has no impact on the BSC behavior.

class.name: AutomaticGsmHealingReport
class.description: Contains the functionality Automatic GSM Healing report configuration.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='aghReportRule' test="( (not((../@administrativeState = 0) and (@generateReport = 1))) )">It is not possible to generate a report when the attribute AutomaticGsmHealing.administrativeState is set to LOCKED. Faulty MO: <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='aghReportRule' test="( (not((../@administrativeState = 0) and (@generateReport = 1))) )">It is not possible to generate a report when the attribute AutomaticGsmHealing.administrativeState is set to LOCKED. Faulty MO: <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: automaticGsmHealingReportId
attribute.description: Holds the name when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: generateReport
attribute.description:
Create a new AGH report.
To create a new AGH report on demand, the value of the attribute should be manually changed to ENABLED. After the report is created, the value of the attribute is automatically changed to DISABLED. A new AGH report is automatically created daily at 00:10.

attribute.name: reportStatus
attribute.description: Actual status of report generation.
attribute.statusInformation: Since GBSC01.A12 release, change of this attribute has no impact on the BSC behavior.

attribute.name: reportStatus1
attribute.description: Status of AGH report.

class.name: SleepingCellHealing
class.description: Contains the functionality Sleeping Cell Healing.

attribute.name: sleepingCellHealingId
attribute.description: Holds the name when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: State of the functionality Sleeping Cell Healing on the BSC level.

attribute.name: extendedRecoveryState
attribute.description:
State of extended recovery actions on the BSC level that may affect traffic in other cells.
When the state is set to LOCKED, recovery actions that may affect traffic in healthy cells are not executed.
attribute.dependencies: When the state is set to UNLOCKED recovery actions that may affect traffic in healthy cells are executed during recovery period defined by attributes SleepingCellHealing.extendedRecoveryStartTime, SleepingCellHealing.extendedRecoveryStopTime.

attribute.name: extendedRecoveryStartTime
attribute.description: Start time of extended recovery actions on the BSC level that may affect traffic in other cells.

attribute.name: extendedRecoveryStopTime
attribute.description: End time of extended recovery actions on the BSC level that may affect traffic in other cells.

attribute.name: minimalNoTrafficPeriod
attribute.description:
Required number of consecutive hours without traffic to consider the cell as a sleeping cell.
The consecutive hours are counted only within supervision time.
attribute.statusInformation: Since GBSC01.A12 release, change of this attribute has no impact on the BSC behavior.

attribute.name: sleepingCellHealingStatus
attribute.description:
Status of the Sleeping Cell Healing functionality on the BSC level.
STOPPED - sleeping cell detection and recovery are not working. LEARNING - sleeping cell healing functionality is collecting traffic pattern data. Detected alarms can trigger execution of recovery actions only if the SleepingCellHealing.administrativeState is set to UNLOCKED. DETECTING - sleeping cells are being detected and required recovery actions can be executed only if the SleepingCellHealing.administrativeState is set to UNLOCKED.
attribute.statusInformation: Since GBSC01.A12 release, change of this attribute has no impact on the BSC behavior.

attribute.name: minimalNoTrafficPeriod1
attribute.description:
Required number of consecutive hours without traffic to consider the cell as a sleeping cell.
The consecutive hours are counted only within supervision time.

attribute.name: sleepingCellHealingStatus1
attribute.description:
Status of the Sleeping Cell Healing functionality on the BSC level.
STOPPED - sleeping cell detection and recovery are not working. LEARNING - sleeping cell healing functionality is collecting traffic pattern data. Detected alarms can trigger execution of recovery actions only if the SleepingCellHealing.administrativeState is set to UNLOCKED. DETECTING - sleeping cells are being detected and required recovery actions can be executed only if the SleepingCellHealing.administrativeState is set to UNLOCKED.

class.name: BscDailyRule
class.description: Contains the daily rule functionality on the BSC level.

attribute.name: bscDailyRuleId
attribute.description: Holds the name when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: detectionStartTime
attribute.description: Time when sleeping cell detection and recovery actions start on the BSC level for a weekday.

attribute.name: detectionStopTime
attribute.description:
Time when sleeping cell detection and recovery actions stop on the BSC level for a weekday.
If detectionStopTime is earlier than detectionStartTime, then it means that supervision ends at the next weekday.

class.name: CellDetectionRule
class.description: Contains the Sleeping Cell Detection Rule functionality.

attribute.name: cellDetectionRuleId
attribute.description: Holds the name when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: sleepingCellHealingState
attribute.description: State of the functionality Sleeping Cell Healing on the cell level.
attribute.dependencies: When the attribute SleepingCellHealing.administrativeState is locked, change of this attribute has no impact on Sleeping Cell Healing functionality behavior.

attribute.name: extendedRecoveryState
attribute.description:
State of extended recovery actions on the cell level that may affect traffic in other cells.
For IMMEDIATE state extended recovery actions are executed immediately.
attribute.dependencies: When the state is set to UNLOCKED recovery actions that may affect traffic in healthy cells are executed during recovery period defined by attributes SleepingCellHealing.extendedRecoveryStartTime, SleepingCellHealing.extendedRecoveryStopTime.

class.name: CellDailyRule
class.description: Contains daily rule functionality on the cell level.

attribute.name: cellDailyRuleId
attribute.description: Holds the name when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: detectionStartTime
attribute.description: Time when sleeping cell detection and recovery actions start on the cell level for a weekday.

attribute.name: detectionStopTime
attribute.description:
Time when sleeping cell detection and recovery actions stop on the cell level for a weekday.
If detectionStopTime is earlier than detectionStartTime, then it means that supervision ends at the next weekday.
